Detailed Description

Validator class.

This class is used to validate data.

Boo validation functions ignore leading and trailing whitespace. For example Boo_Validator::isInt(" 16 ") will return TRUE.

License:
http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt GNU General Public License
Link:
http://code.ramaboo.com/ Boo Framework
Copyright:
2008 David Singer
Author:
David Singer <david@ramaboo.com>
Version:
2.0.0

Definition at line 447 of file Validator.php.

static Boo_Validator::getYesNo (  )  [static]

Validates a value.

Use # (pound sign) in the validation rule to represent the value.

You should only use this function if you need to store a validation rule as a string of text such as in an xml file for use with Boo_Form. Calling member functions directly is much more efficient.

Parameters:
string $value The value to validate.
string $validationRule The validation code (must be valid PHP).
bool $required[optional] Value is required (not null).
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE if validation was successful, FALSE otherwise.
 Boo_Validator::validate(5, "Boo_Validator::isInt(#, 3, 8);", true);
 // returns TRUE

Gets the yes or no array.

Returns:
array Returns yes or no array. The key is the integer, value is the word.

static Boo_Validator::isAlpha ( $  string,
$  min = false,
$  max = false 
) [static]

Determins if a value is alphabetic.

Alphabetic is defined as [A-Za-z].

Parameters:
string $string The value to test.
integer $min[optional] The minimum length of the string.
integer $max[optional] The maximum length of the string.
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE if value is alphabetic, FALSE otherwise.
See also:
http://us3.php.net/manual/en/function.ctype-alpha.php

Alphanumeric is defined as [A-Za-z0-9_-.()].

Definition at line 812 of file Validator.php.

static Boo_Validator::isCardNumber ( $  cardNumber  )  [static]

Determins if a credit card number is valid.

Warning:
Uses the Luhn algorithm to check for validity. This may not work correctly for more obsucre credit cards.
See also:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luhn_algorithm
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE if card number is valid, FALSE otherwise.
Parameters:
string $cardNumber The card number to test.

Definition at line 1128 of file Validator.php.

Referenced by Boo_Format::formatCardNumber().

static Boo_Validator::isCardNumberMasked ( $  cardNumber  )  [static]

Determins if a credit card number is masked.

Checks if the first 4 digits of the card number are ****. This function is used to check account information after a user has submited updates. If the card number is masked then they have likely not updated it and it can be ignored (not saved). This is just a quick check and should only be used to determin if a card number should be saved or not. It does not check against manipulation of the card number itself.

Warning:
This function does not check the validity of the masked credit card number
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE if credit card number is masked, FALSE otherwise.
Parameters:
object $cardNumber

Definition at line 1108 of file Validator.php.

static Boo_Validator::isChecked ( $  value  )  [static]

Determines if a checkbox is checked.

Because of the way PHP handles checkboxes this is the same as Boo_Validator::isRequired(). Included for API compatibility.

Parameters:
string $value
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE if checkbox is checked, FALSE otherwise.

static Boo_Validator::isExpDate ( $  expDate  )  [static]

Determins if an expiration date is valid.

Expiration date can be in the following formats:

  • MMYY
  • MM/YY
  • MM-YY
  • MMYYYY
  • MM/YYYY
  • MM-YYYY
  • YYYY-MM-DD
  • YYYY/MM/DD
See also:
Boo_Format::formatExpDate
Parameters:
string $expDate The expiration date to test.
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE if expiration date is valid, FALSE otherwise.

static Boo_Validator::isInt ( $  string,
$  min = false,
$  max = false 
) [static]

Determins if a string is an integer.

Preforms the same function as the built in PHP function ctype_digit() except this will allow negative integers and does not require a string variable.

Parameters:
string $string The test string.
int $min Minimum value of the number.
int $max Maximum value of the number.
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.
See also:

static Boo_Validator::isNull ( $  string  )  [static]

Determins if a value is null.

Important! This is not the same as is_null().

The following values are considered null:

  • A string with only spaces.
  • An empty string.
  • NULL.
  • FALSE.
  • An empty array.
Parameters:
mixed $string The string to test.
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE if value is null, FALSE otherwise.
Todo:
Fix to test objects.

static Boo_Validator::isPhoneExtension ( $  phoneExt  )  [static]

Determins if a phone extension is valid.

Valid formats are:

  • x123456
  • 123456

Where 123456 can be any number from 1 to 999999.

Returns:
bool Returns TRUE if extension is valid, FALSE otherwise.
Parameters:
string $phoneExt The phone extension to test.

Definition at line 1505 of file Validator.php.

static Boo_Validator::isPrice ( $  string,
$  min = false,
$  max = false 
) [static]

Determins if a string is a price.

The maximum price is 16 characters or 14 with 2 decimal places. This is the same as MySQL 5 datatype decimal(16,2).

Parameters:
string $string The test string.
int $min Minimum value of the number.
int $max Maximum value of the number.
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.

static Boo_Validator::isSocialSecurityNumber ( $  ssNumber  )  [static]

Determins if string is a Social Security number.

Social Security number can be in any format. Use Boo_Format::formatSocialSecurityNumber() if you want the data properly formated.

Warning:
This function is only a rough validator as it does not check for reserved numbers such as 666-xx-xxxx or xxx-xx-0000, etc.
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE if string is a Socical Security number, FALSE otherwise.
Parameters:
string $ssNumber The string to test.
See also:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_security_number

Used by the ORDER BY SQL statment. Possible directions are:

  • DESC

static Boo_Validator::isSqlSafe ( $  string,
$  min = false,
$  max = false 
) [static]

Checks if string is safe to use in an SQL statement.

Safe characters are all letters, numbers, dash, and the underscore.

Parameters:
$string The string to test.
integer $min[optional] The minimum length of the name.
integer $max[optional] The maximum length of the name.
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE if string is safe, FALSE otherwise.

static Boo_Validator::isVin ( $  vin  )  [static]

Validates a vehical identification number aginst the ISO 3779 standard.

1M8GDM9AXKP042788 is a valid VIN (used for testing).

See also:
http://ramaboo.com/code/is_vin/
http://code.google.com/p/isvin/
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vehicle_identification_number
Parameters:
string $vin The vehical identification number.
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE if the vehical identification number is valid, FALSE otherwise.
License:
http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt GNU General Public License
Copyright:
2008 David Singer
Author:
David Singer <david@ramaboo.com>
Version:
1.1.3
 if (is_vin('1M8GDM9AXKP042788')) {
    echo 'valid';
 } else {
    echo 'not valid';
 }
Todo:
Test and support ISO 3780.

Member Data Documentation

Boo_Validator::$countries [static, protected]

Array of countries.

The array contains the country names (official short names in English) in alphabetical order as given in ISO 3166-1 and the corresponding ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 code. The array index is the ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 code in strtoupper format. The array value is the short country name in ucword format (with the exception of the words "of, "and", "the). There are currently 246 countries in the array.

Updated 2008-08-08.

See also:
http://www.iso.org/iso/country_codes/iso_3166_code_lists/

Definition at line 34 of file Validator.php.

Referenced by Boo_Helper::getCountryNameByCode().

Definition at line 349 of file Validator.php.

Boo_Validator::$states [static, protected]

Array of states.

The array contains all 50 state names plus the District of Columbia in alphabetical order and the corisponding abbreviations. The array index is the state abbreviation in strtoupper format. The array value is the state name in ucword format (with the exception of the word "of"). There are currently 51 states in the array.
